title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon - Wikipedia
snippet: He rejects the labels of radical left or far-left that the press has often ascribed to his political positions. According to historian Jean-Numa Ducange, Mélenchon became for many the main representative of the historical French left during the 2017 presidential election, scoring 20%, far ahead of the Socialist Party candidate Benoît Hamon, and was not a radical leftist, having unconditionally supported the Plural Left that was in power between 1997 and 2002, and having himself been a minister in this government between 2000 and 2002.

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon, the rabble-rouser leading the new French left – POLITICO
snippet: The former Trotskyist has emerged as a commanding figure in France’s post-Socialist left after forging an unlikely left-wing alliance ahead of the legislative elections

title: Who Is Jean-Luc Melenchon? All About The New Popular Front Leader | Europe - Times Now
snippet: Jean-Luc Melenchon, born on August 19, 1951, in Tangier, Morocco, is the son of a postmaster and a primary school teacher.After working as a teacher for a while, Melenchon entered politics in September 1976 and joined the Socialist Party (PS).
